CatDescriptText: Jack Godfrey, bartender, 6914 Bennett Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1959, pg. 32 with question: "Do you believe in capital punishment? If so, do you  think that it should be imposed on convicted defendants under the age of 21?" answer reads: "Whoever conceived the idea of capital punishment, in my estimation, is wrong.  In fact, I say that such a law and that for the sentencing of youngsters under the age of 21 years should be given to the people for a referendum in which they would vote on it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jack Godfrey wearing dark cap, eyeglasses, plaid scarf, and dark overcoat with up turned collar, standing with hands behind back on sidewalk in front of brick building with stone pillar railing
